title: Interaction Between Cognitive Biases in Language Structure and Repetitive Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of language structures and exposure to cognitive bias concepts
context.additional_context: Operation of microlearning modules using personal smartphones/tablets. Conducting project-based assessments in a BYOD environment. Structuring 15-minute video/quiz/activity units aligned with the concentration cycles of teenage learners.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more mechanisms by which linguistic structures are influenced by cognitive biases.
Learners can simulate the formation process of Zipfian distribution through repeated learning experiments.
Learners can analyze cognitive bias cases in real-world language data through project deliverables.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
